choices.name: jQuery 2.x (new version, lighter, IE9+)
None (Angular will use its own jqLite)

name: ui
message: Which UI framework do you want?

choices.name: Bootstrap, the most popular HTML, CSS, and JS framework
Angular Material, the reference implementation of the Google's Material Design specification
None

name: bootstrapVersion
message: Which Bootstrap verison would you like to use?

choices.name: The latest version of bootstrap (Currently in beta)
The mature and stable version of bootstrap

name: bootstrapComponents
message: How do you want to implement your Bootstrap components?

choices.name: Angular UI Bootstrap, Bootstrap components written in pure AngularJS by the AngularUI Team
The official jQuery implementation of Bootstrap
No JavaScript, just CSS

name: cssPreprocessor
message: Which CSS preprocessor do you want?

choices.name: Sass (Node), Node.js binding to libsass, the C version of the popular stylesheet preprocessor, Sass.
Sass (Ruby), Original Syntactically Awesome StyleSheets (requires Ruby)
Less, extends the CSS language, adding features that allow variables, mixins, functions and many other techniques.
Stylus, supporting both an indented syntax and regular CSS style.
None, only the good old CSS

name: jsPreprocessor
message: Which JS preprocessor do you want?

choices.name: None, I like to code in standard JavaScript.
ES6 (Babel formerly 6to5), ECMAScript 6 compiled with Babel which requires no runtime.
ES6 (Traceur), ECMAScript 6 compiled with the Traceur compiler from Google.
CoffeeScript, "a little language that compiles into JavaScript".
TypeScript, a typed superset of JavaScript that compiles to plain JavaScript.

name: htmlPreprocessor
message: Which HTML template engine would you want?

choices.name: None, I like to code in standard HTML.
Jade (*.jade)
Haml (*.haml)
Handlebars (*.hbs)
